attributes.action: recommend the award of a posthumous Knighthood to Alex Henshaw for his services to the nation's air defences during the Second World War.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Alex Henshaw, although turned down by the Royal Air Force, dedicated his life to the testing and preparation of Spitfire aircraft for delivery from the manufacturer, sometimes test flying 20 aircraft in a day in all weathers. 
This was a particularly dangerous form of flying, due to the unknown nature of the individual aircraft, yet Henshaw accepted the risks to ensure that sufficient machines were ready for delivery.
Prior to and after the war, he claimed a number of aviation recordsat great personal risk, contributing to the opening up of routes to the British aviation industry.

rejection.details: The Cabinet Office is actively seeking nominations for honours from the public. Please go to http://www.direct.gov.uk/honours
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
